messages.subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] OT Yahoo...
messages.msgSnippet: ... I know Tracy, and sorry if I sounded critical.  I guess I am just wear of judgemental people in my life, and saw fault where none was present.  Sorry if I
messages.messageBody:
>I was passing the info on in the spirit of believing
>that some would like to know about this. Tracy

I know Tracy, and sorry if I sounded critical. I guess I am just wear of judgemental people in my life, and saw fault where none was present. Sorry if I upset you, as it really was not meant as a personal attack.

Nanci K.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] OT Yahoo...
messages.msgSnippet:  You know, it always seems strange to me that people who want to live their lives in a way counter to culture in some aspects and be left alone to do it
messages.messageBody:
You know, it always seems strange to me that people who
want to live their lives in a way counter to culture in
some aspects and be left alone to do it (Unschoolers)
can also be so upset by anyone else wanting the same
freedoms. We may not agree with other people's
choices, but they ARE other people's choices, and would
we rather they not be able to choose?

Nanci K.

I was passing the info on in the spirit of believing
that some would like to know about this. This is also
about people being able to choose, in this case to
choose whether they want their email list to be
associated with a company supplying a controversial
product. As it turns out, they've decided to stop
altogether.

Tracy

   Sheree

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] OT Yahoo...
messages.msgSnippet: Hello, everyone, I m new to the list, and new to homeschooling.  I live and Alexandria, Va and my three girls ages 3, 5, and 8 are coming out of Montessori
messages.messageBody:
Hello, everyone, I'm new to the list, and new to homeschooling.  I live and Alexandria, Va and my three girls ages 3, 5, and 8 are coming out of Montessori schooling, and are very comfortable with this transition.
 
I want to pass this link along, as it seems the folks at Yahoo have had a change of mind:
 
http://biz.yahoo.com/bw/010413/0020.html
 
Annette

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] OT Yahoo...

In a message dated 04/12/2001 8:35:27 PM !!!First Boot!!!,
tracy.oldfield@... writes:


.  I thought I'd spread the word, figured many people
would not be comfortable using Yahoo for list business under these

Nance

messages.subject: Re: OT Yahoo...
messages.msgSnippet: ... Hello Tracy; Thank you for the information, and you are right, alot of people, me included, will not be comfortable using Yahoo for our web sites or
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., "Tracy Oldfield"
<tracy.oldfield@n...> wrote:
> has decided to expand its range of 'adult' products into hardcore
> porn it seems. I thought I'd spread the word, figured many people
> would not be comfortable using Yahoo for list business under these
> circumstances.
>
> http://news.excite.com/news/ap/010411/19/brf-yahoo-porn
>
> Anyway, just spreading the word...
>
> Tracy

Hello Tracy;
Thank you for the information, and you are right, alot of people,
me included, will not be comfortable using Yahoo for our web sites or
businesses.
There are many that will defend this as a freedom of speech issue,
or that is it is everyone's right to do whatever they want, including
spread porn. They could be right...but, we also have the right not to
support businesses that make their money this way. I for one, would
have been happy to pay a small fee to use yahoo groups. If this is
just a way for Yahoo to make money, maybe they should have thought to
ask....
Regards to all,
Sheree

messages.subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] OT Yahoo...
messages.msgSnippet: has decided to expand its range of adult products into hardcore porn it seems.  I thought I d spread the word, figured many people would not be comfortable
messages.messageBody:
has decided to expand its range of 'adult' products into hardcore
porn it seems. I thought I'd spread the word, figured many people
would not be comfortable using Yahoo for list business under these
circumstances.
Tracy

You know, it always seems strange to me that people who want to live their lives in a way counter to culture in some aspects and be left alone to do it (Unschoolers) can also be so upset by anyone else wanting the same freedoms. We may not agree with other people's choices, but they ARE other people's choices, and would we rather they not be able to choose?

Nanci K.
